documenttitle.text: Red Hat Enhancement Advisory: webkit2gtk3 enhancement update

note.text: An updated webkit2gtk3 package that adds one enhancement is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
This update adds the following enhancement:

* Update WebKitGTK to 2.24.4 (BZ#1755824).

Users of webkit2gtk3 are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which adds this enhancement.
note.title: Details

note.text: Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.4, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, tvOS 12.4, Safari 12.1.2, iTunes for Windows 12.9.6, iCloud for Windows 7.13, iCloud for Windows 10.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1876626: CVE-2019-8644 webkitgtk: Multiple memory corruption issues leading to arbitrary code execution

note.text: A logic issue existed in the handling of synchronous page loads. This issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.4, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, tvOS 12.4, Safari 12.1.2, iTunes for Windows 12.9.6, iCloud for Windows 7.13, iCloud for Windows 10.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1876628: CVE-2019-8649 webkitgtk: Incorrect state management leading to universal cross-site scripting

note.text: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting.
